Job Title: Senior Art Director - (Hybrid) NY,NY

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
Who We Are

We are a recognized global content creation and marketing agency designed to work at the speed of news. At our core, we are a diverse collective of creators, thinkers, and doers who are positively obsessed with our clients. We make it our business to uncover what’s unique about their business, then make it resonate with audiences. We’re all about creative problem solving and can take even the most complicated product or service offering and make it easy for audiences to understand, embrace and, most of all, trust.

What We Do

Combining innovative design, compelling narrative and cutting-edge technology, we use every tool in our arsenal to illuminate what makes our clients’ products special. We connect brands with the right customers, across a rich and varied landscape of media. We believe in extending the “big idea” beyond traditional media by creating robust digital platforms that connect both on-line and off-line marketing to consumers at the most poignant times and in the most interesting ways. We believe that extraordinary marketing can be both a discipline and an art form. The art is in doing it well. The discipline is in doing it right. We are Designory / eg+

Schedule: Hybrid - In office three days per week and 2 remote

Location: New York, NY - Hybrid - Global Headquarters of Dow Jones (1211 Avenue of the Americas)

with a minimum of 3 days a week on site

Reports to: Creative Director

Salary Range: $100,000 to $115,000 a year

This position is employed by Designory and embedded within the client organization

at Dow Jones. It augments the Dow Jones marketing team and serves as an extension

of the creative team for Dow Jones’s B2B and B2C marketing departments and our

agency (eg+), located at 1285 Avenue of the Americas.

About This Role

eg+ is looking for a skilled Sr. Art Director with proven experience designing for all channels — digital, social, static and video.

You should be an insightful visual storyteller who inherently collaborates with a copywriter to bring original creative thinking to life in concepts, spec creative, storyboards, and the like.

The Sr. AD needs to be driven, accountable, and work efficiently under quick-turn timelines.

As this role is on-site and embedded with Dow Jones’s marketing team, it requires not only a strong portfolio, but also a PMA: positive mental attitude.

Wit, energy, and strategic insight will move you to the front of the line. Is this you? Then let’s get the conversation started.

Responsibilities

Develop insightful and impactful concepts and flawless executionsPresent creative ideas with clarity and confidenceCollaborate with and learn from marketing leads, strategists, copywriters, developers, editors and the like throughout all aspects of the creative and production processListen attentively, ask insightful questions, and carefully interpret and apply feedbackEnjoy working in a high-energy, speed-of-news environmentPossess a strong command of the Adobe Suite and FigmaKeep up on the news and on current social trends

Qualifications

6 to 10 years’ experience in a traditional and or content marketing agency with B2C and B2B experienceMinimum 3 years as a Sr. Art DirectorMultichannel experience is a must. Strong video portfolio.Strong preference for media or news experienceExpertise in Figma and the Adobe SuiteProven creative/marketing design and art direction skills; portfolio requiredExcellent communications skills — written and oralSelf-directed, motivated, and resourceful with excellent time management Team leadership and having onsite experience is an advantage.BA in Marketing, Advertising, Design or related fieldExperience in the newsroom or as a content creator is a plusMust be experienced and comfortable using a Macintosh computer and OS

_______________________________

Designory is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Designory does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Experience Level (if available): Director
